* Farfetch'd got a pre-evolution and evolution as it's now in the role of regional bird alongside another Pokemon.

* Yanma gets a pre-evolution and is an early route bug.

* Nosepass gets a pre-evolution while Sudowoodo get an evolution as both lines are now in a similar role to Geodude and Roggenrola

* Normal/Ghost regional variant of Gengar based off standard white bedsheet ghosts

I recently came up with a dex which I'd post if I could be bothered to create and upload a text file. I tried to make it mostly out of unimpressive and largely forgotten mons, but ofc what's considered "forgettable" is largely subjective so some of my choices probably aren't perfect

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Just got done playing for about 6 hours. Pretty fun game. I actually like autobattlers so the game is up my alley, but I wish there was an actual in-game button to fast forward because I can see people being really frustrated with how slow it can feel if they aren't using emu speed options.

The dungeons need work. The Ariados fight is buggy as fuck, but that aside the fact that you can't run from any random encounters in dungeons is really lame. Having to stop and beat down one level 14 psyduck and being unable to escape because THE POKEMON IS TOO FIERCE is stupid.

Writing is a mixed bag. Liked doing most of the sidequests and stuff, but the church being overtly evil to the point of cartoonishly so was annoying. The rival seems fun with throwing out his single level 5 starter against your full team being a fun introduction because he knows nothing about battling as a spoiled prince type.

All in all, pretty excited for more content. Going to be watching it.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52879266
Aside from the whole 'the futuristic/scifi elements of area Zero make the most sense with Violet' thing mentioned above, there's also a bit of dialogue that everyone seems to overlook. At the very beginning of the game, Koraidon/Miraidon saves you from the Houndoom and you meet up with Nemona outside the cave, your 'Raidon loses energy and slumps back down from Battle 'form' into its default 'form'.Nemona then comments 'Wow, it transformed! It's like a totally different Pokemon!'; Arven comments on its change of appearance as well. The catch: the only one of the two Legendaries that actually transforms is Miraidon (its legs suck into its Hadron Engines, it gets that sparkly blue energy on its underside, and it gets those lightning bolt-like antennae on its head), while Koraidon doesn't really change physically at all (it just stands upright and puffs out its dewlap). Nemona's and Arven's comments on your Legendary 'transforming' and 'looking totally different' only really make sense with Miraidon, and thus the dialogue only makes sense in Violet. This, along with the more coherent scific themes in the final area, the fact that Turo actually looks more like a traditional Pokemon Professor than Sada, the parental abandonment plot which works better with Sada taking baby Arven and abandoning Turo to his obsession (rather than having the father be the one to run off with the kid after the mother basically just ignored the child she carried for 9 months and unceremoniously pumped out only to favor Koraidon over Arven instead in Scarlet), and other little details all seem to suggest the story was written for Violet first, then tweaked for the inverse in Scarlet.
Of course, this is irrelevant, because Pokemon has established that the series is a multiverse, so both versions are simultaneously canon and happen on parallel timelines.

The existence of Violet and the adherence to the two game format is the whole reason the imagination theory exists.
If the game was just Scarlet, you bet we'd have tons of fossil Pokemon running around in area 0 or in the wilds of paldea.
But since gamefreak never designed "future" pokemon throughout the years, we never got that. Now it looks like a plot hole. Same for the lack of fossils proving any of these Pokemon could have existed. There's no alternative for the future game so scarlet gets handicapped for it.
We're stuck with an awkward hybrid that never 100% fits either game. That's why the imagination theory will probably end up being right- it's the only one that allows both versions to exist.

Basically, the order of events is this:
>Professor pulls the second Raidon through the machine, which attacks the first one that had already been with them for years. The more aggressive Raidon wounds the first one, and the professor throws themselves between the two to block the death blow while urging the wounded Raidon to flee.

>Arven, fed up at being ignored by his parent all these years, attempts to enter Area Zero; however, he finds the lab's teleporters are locked down. He attempts to find another way into the area, but gets attacked by an unknown Paradox Pokemon. Mabosstiff is wounded in the process, and he's forced to turn back. When he realizes his potions and the local Pokemon Centers aren't able to heal his Mabosstiff's injuries, and unable to make it to his parents' base because of the locked down teleporters, he makes his way to his parent's old lab at the lighthouse to look for some way to contact them for help.
>Meanwhile, the injured Raidon flies out of the crater, making it out before the barrier around the crater is activated. Some people say AI Sada was misplaced compared to Turo, but I believe she creates a more unique juxtaposition between her means and ends: instead of using futuristic technology to propel the world forward, she used it in an attempt to restore a primitive, prehistoric era. Because it seems the only thing they were wishing for in that moment was for the good Koraidon/Miraidon to survive, hence why they threw themselves in front of a lethal blow instead of just turning tail and running for the door themselves. That being said, I suspect the professor's real final wish was to see their project to completion at any cost, which led to the creation of the Paradise Protection Program failsafe coming into existence, hence why the AI had no idea the thing existed even though it helped build the machine in the first place.

>>52865523
Hanke's suckered me into doing GBL full-time. I've gotten over 700k stardust so far this season (1.5m last season doing only Master League and the GO Battle Days, aka the first season I actually tried) and I've used the rank 19 ECTM to give my perfect lvl. 41 Reshiram Fusion Flare. While I feel significantly more mental pain every day, including a new variant of stress headaches that hurt a lot worse, it'll still be worth it once I'll no longer have to invite other people to any mega raids that'll ever come up in the future.

If you can put up with it, I'd recommend at the very least throwing in whatever you want and doing at least whatever amount of battles you need to do during GO Battle Days specifically. You'll get a ton of stardust just by getting at least one win per set, and the timed research that gives you an Elite Charge TM usually doesn't care if you win or loss, so it basically only costs your sanity. I've paid in my sanity, and I'd say it was mostly worth shaving three years off my life from stress.

Not this anon, but many BDSP teams had subtle changes like fixing IV allocation between the (second) day1 patch and further updates.

Another one, rescue team dx is the first mystery dungeon game to use timestamped rescue codes, which are tied to the switch "internet clock" which isn't modified when you change the time in system settings, making it impossible to use old codes on any console that has ever connected to the internet.

And to top it off, it was technically still possible to connect japanese crystal to a mobile phone to battle and trade remotely until sometime late 2020, due to the discontinuation of the last carrier compatible with a supported mobile phone.

>>52871935
Garchomps design is based off of the A10 Warthog.
More specifically, the A10 and its shark-mouthed nose art (The A10 is one of the few aircraft remaining which is still allowed to have shark-mouth nose art, for cultural reasons.)
As this picture shows, from a frontal perspective, a Garchomps head bears a startling similarity to the attack jet. Of particular note are the twin jet engines, which mimic Garchomps horns pretty much to a T.
This can be seen in Pokdex descriptions, also. Notably, Garchomps entry in pokemon diamond
>When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane.
And pearl
>It flies at speeds equal to a jet fighter plane.

>What's your favorite starter pairing?
I haven't got one, I don't think about pairings that much lol
I guess torchic/treecko. I'm biased because that's my favorite pairing i've used, as well as two starters from my favorite starter trio, but I feel like they gel really well together. Can imagine Torchic being the overexcited little girl who's just happy to be a pokemon while treecko is the level-headed teenager trying really hard to look cool but breaking down and being a total sweetheart in her presence.

>What was your first game?
technically Explorers of Time, but I had a flashcard with every DS game sans Sky on it so I just played through all of them

>Have you been reading any good comics/fanfiction?
considering that at least 20% of my life is devoted to reading every pmd comic that I feel is worth even a minute of my time, yes lol
I've already said it before, but I'll repeat regardless
>anamnesis
>abridgestery
>on borrowed time
>milos from home
>another perspective
>team rowanberry
all on comicfury, now go read them you fucks

>Explorers remake or new game?
new game, holy shit. If they're going to keep up the mediocrity of DX, I'd rather they not do so by fucking up an Explorer's remake and dooming the fandom to even more doomposting

>What is your definition of "soul?"
i'd say it's a combination of attention to detail, atmosphere, and subtlety
if it has good music, little details that reinforce the worldbuilding and add to immersion, and gameplay that's good enough not to frequently frustrate, it'd fit the definition
if I'm riding into a town, I wanna be able to enter a house and talk to someone to hear about how the local economy works. I want to be surprised by something cute like Shuckle's juice thing in gen 2. I wanna feel like i'm either in the world or a trance due to how much I'm liking the experience. Hard to quantify, and it's still ultimately subjective, but meh

>>52876140
Honestly it is still Sylveon who is the worst.
After all the buffs Espeon obtained it has the best lane gameplay while also able to help secure objectives. Despite what people think Espeon best set, it is Stored power/Future sight. But since that set requires more skill such as knowing when to use stored power to disbursed big damage on all enemies or locking onto 1 enemy with FS, most prefer psyshock/future sight

Glaceon is 2nd because its a jungle crit machine that has the most consistent/highest damage crits. Glaceon can do well in lane if not doing jungle but Espeon is a better laner than Glaceon. But Glaceon has no issues carrying team fights or securing objectives with icy/dry if jungle or lane, its just a mon that does better in jungle but if a teammate needs to jungle then Glaceon can give it up. Spear/shard is out dated and a meme build with no mobility.

Sylveon is the worst out of the 3 because while MF/DK buffs does let it 1v1 well, but it has no CC in a team fights. You can only try to rush onto 1 enemy and pick them off while the rest of your team handles the team fight. Plus MF/DK is absolutely horrible in securing objectives. If eleki/regi/fug drops a sylveon MF/DK can only kill or pester enemies as the remaining team attempts to get the objectives and knowing Soloq that is not reliable. HV/CM is good for Sp-atk teams for team fights and has good secure on objectives but their are better targets to use over HV/CM.

posts.name: Anonymous

I’ve been of the opinion for the last decade that GF need to get rid of IVs. Outside of very niche situations where certain Pokémon want 0 IVs in a given stat (namely for Trick Room shenanigans which can be covered by giving a Pokémon a -Speed Nature), the only thing they really affected was the Type for Hidden Power. As it doesn’t doesn’t exist as a move anymore, I do see IVs being needed anymore either.

>Hoenn was the one case where tuning up the cartoonishness was benefitial, because they are sillier games with a plot about over the top ecoterrorism
It wasn't, turning everyone into an over the top caricature is one of the easiest ways to make nobody take your plot seriously and this even applies to plots like gen 3's which was incredibly stupid. It breaks immersion. The villains being retarded is one thing. But the character who's supposed to be an honor student making a goofy pose rather than actually taking her job seriously is something else entirely. Especially when back in emerald in the match call roxanne was talking about how much responsibility being a gym leader is.

>Remember that this is the same region that gave us characters like Wallace, Watson, Steven and Winona.
Both Wattson and Winona have different characters than Roxanne. Wattson is a jolly old man and Winona's design barely changes. Whoever designed Wallace's New design didn't know the difference between Flamboyant and Gay, And Steven simply had a hobby.
Also Flannery was popular well before ORASS was a thing.
>Ginger Pirates
Old Team Aqua were far more interestingly designed than New team Aqua for that very reason, Being Ginger let them stick out, It also might've been a nod to nami from one piece but that's a massive stretch. I'm not nearly against their redesign as some other people are because I know they are just tanned.

Yeah, the only region I haven't repeated starters is in Johto, but that's because I like all three Johto starters. I also like all Hoenn starters, but since Breloom is my favourite gen 3 Pokémon and I don't like repeating types in my teams I'd end up not choosing Treeko.

Not only that, but the starters I choose usually end up harmonizing well with the rest of my team type-wise; for example, basically all of the water-types I used were starters until I forced myself to use more water-types.

posts.com: Finished violet fighting monolocke (no overlevelling or sleep). I allowed myself soft resetting on wipe after having to reset once and I ceebs going through the tutorial every time. I only had to soft reset for the Clavell fight. The strategy of the team at the end was to set up dual screens with medicham then setup Belly drum on Hariyama or Swords Dance on Gallade with everyone else as support/sweeping. I enjoyed using Passimian, it hits like a truck and had a lot of utility with Taunt/U-turn. Honorable mentions include Hawlucha who functioned very similarly. I also occasionally used Pawmot for speed control and for baton passing +2 agility, but doing the whole screens + agi pass + belly drum setup was a bit too finnicky.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>52875427
Johto will always seem fresh to me. Years down the line and out of all the pokemon in the entire franchise, Johto seems to have hit this perfect mix of weird and out of place, but with endearing and cool qualities to its batch of pokemon. The only other gen I can think of that almost captured that feel, but veered a bit too much on making some lines goofy, was Unova.

Kalos was sort of the tipping point where it still had solid designs that felt unique to the franchise. Everything after Alola feels like Pokemon were designed trying to follow trends or competitors. Kanto feels like a product of its time, Hoenn works as a mix of the previous installments, and Sinnoh sort of had a similar design philosophy to Johto, but managed to work it out differently with cross-evolutions and the like.

>>52877870
Did some math which is too messy to format in a post. Numbers referenced from Smogon's strategydex (slightly different from OP, includes Cinderace in Gen 9 for example which seems like a sure thing this month)

I think there's some interesting trends here, hard to draw a lot of conclusions though. The number of Pokémon in OU staying more or less the same between Gen 4 and 7 while the total number of Pokémon almost doubles is definitely interesting.
It should also be considered that Gen 8 and Gen 9 have a curated Dex which definitely affects the results. I'd love to compare Gen 9 with SwSh 1.0's meta, I'm sure a lot of Galar Pokémon got flushed out of their niche when the DLC brought back a ton of old mons and basically every Legendary.
It also misses other factors of powercreep, like new Pokémon (especially non-Legendaries) that were so strong they rose to Ubers, like Aegislash, Dracovish, and half a dozen Megas in Gen 6. And it doesn't consider game mechanics like Z-Moves and Dynamaxing.

>>52878201

>>52879122
>I really hope a lot of this is new toy syndrome but that can only be the lower levels of OU at best. The top is gonna stay that way.
We're not even 2 full months into the meta. The top definitely won't stay this way, even in the high ladder.
Not even accounting for Home and potential DLC, just look at how quickly attitudes toward certain mons changed.
Espathra, over the course of the last month, went from being completely ignored in OU and dropping to UU, people realizing the Stored Power set is pretty good, everyone spamming that set, Espathra being declared to be unbeatable if it can get going, people calling for it to be banned, everyone realizing that it's pretty easy to stop it from getting going, and its usage dropping enough that it didn't even rise to OU.
Shit like this is why I'm against quickbans in general. The meta changes really quickly, especially so early on.

>>52879090
I would consider Megas to be a form change, in contrast to something like regional variants which are fundamentally new Pokémon. If you're using a Mega Charizard you're still just bringing a Charizard to the battle.
I made the distinction in the big autism post up there, native Kalos Pokémon are practically non-existent but Megas dominate Gen 6 and even Gen 7 (14/50, more representation than Alola Pokémon).
Speaking of Alola, it's carried hard by the Ultra Beasts and Legendaries. The only normal Alola mons in Gen 7 OU are Kommo-o and Toxapex, and none of them made it to Ubers.

posts.com: Aegislash and Greninja bans (together with the new Blaziken ban) were the first time completely regular Pokémon without being legendary being banned to Ubers with the sole exception of Garchomp in Gen 4. >>52877195
When it goes up, the raid target takes less damage and they clear all status effects.

They are also immune to status effects from attacks like toxic, will o wisp, and thunder wave but are NOT immune to the secondary status effects like lava plume, discharge, and poison tail.

The shield also makes them immune to stat downs like growl and charm but are NOT immune to stat downs of secondary effects like shadow ball reduces sp defense

a pokemon who is terastatlized deals extra damage to the shield. To become terastralized, you need to make three damaging attacks.


anything else?

posts.com:
>>52877317
>'creative' tera type

You wanna expand on that? Not sure what you mean. But that fact is that becoming a tera type erases both your other types.

for example in the charizard raids: azumarill is water/fairy and has resistance to chaizards fire attacks, focus blast, and was immune to dragon attacks leaving charizard with only hurricane to use

when azumarill tera's fairy for the damage boost, it loses the resistance to fire damage. that means cahrizard is blasting azumarill with sunny day boosted solar power boosted STAB fire blasts that can burn it which greatly reduces its power. In that instance, it would be best for azumarill to hold off on terastralizing until it can it her one shot charizard or charizard puts its shield up

What set are you using?

I built a gastrodon after seeing this, maxed HP and spdef. Leftovers + chilling water, earth power, tera blast (grass) and rain dance.

Experience with the set was mixed but only did 2 raids. Storm drain didn’t eat as many water moves as I was hoping, only 1x per raid. I was expecting more spatk boosts but it didnt happen. Putting evs in defense meant my attacks didnt do too much, especially vs neutral targets. I’ll probably keep running it because I have no good support mons.

Did a 6* water tauros (tera normal) raid - chilling water probably saved us because he output a ton of damage with close combat + headbutt.

Then did a 5* gyarados (fire tera). My team looked good in the lobby but they turned out to all be level 60-80 and could not do any damage despite stab and water tera. Ended up running out of timer close to the finish - we might have been able to win if i had used rain dance to get more damage, but i didnt want to enable hurricanes. Definitely would not have lost this raid if I was using azumarill or other attacking mon.

They need to add a level requirement or allow you to see your team’s summary in lobby, there is no reason you should be allowed to use a level 60 mon in an online raid.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>Vs Atticus
>Skuntank
I send in Sceccu, who Terastalizes immediately.
The Skuntank manages to deal some nasty damage with a Sucker Punch Crit right of the bat, but Stamina will weaken most followiing blows. High Horsepower deletes the Skunk.
>Revavroom
It Iron Heads Sceccu, but does less than impressive damage, and Stamina keeps racking up.
High Horsepower takes the motor mon out.
>Muk
It uses Sludge Wave, but it does fairly little- just enough to push Sceccu into Mago Berry range. Stamina keeps stacking.
High Horsepower misses, and Muk scores a Sludge Wave crit before falling to a second attempt. More Stamina is building up.
>Navi Starmobile
Spin Out does basically nothing except put Sceccu's defense up to +5, and High Horsepower does about half of the Starmobile's health.
Another Spin Out caps out Sceccu's defense just in time for him to end the fight with another High Horsepower.
I honestly think Stamina Mudsdale is seriously banworthy in Nuzlockes, and if it hadn't been the shiny I caught this run, I would not have run it on my team.

>>52836911
In a world were no other mons but the starters exist, Tepig might be the best, as it has arguably the best typing and matchups of the three.
But in the actual games, it has so many top tier mons that compete for its role. Archeops Flying type somewhat overlaps fire, Darumaka is broken, and the game drowns you in excellent Fighting types.
Meanwhile, Oshawott has almost no competition for the role as best Water-type. The Tympole line is the most notable contender and it is worse overall.
Outside Nuzlockes, Simipour is arguably the best Water-type because it is powerful and can be fully evolved and spamming Scald at level 22, but the frailty makes me think twice. Samurott doesn't really have to contend with it since the best version of the monkey is the gift version(arrives earlier so you don't have to grind later) which you won't get unless you picked Snivy.

>>52855126


>>52851910
Sandile is one of those ones that you just pump full of Defence EVs.
I've noticed that pumping up a big weakness with EVs in an in-game runs tends to end better than maxing out already good stats. Even something Like Sharpedo needs max Attack but only some Speed investment and the rest can go into a Defence or Sp.Defence.

In general if you look at a pokemon stats, investment taking a Defence from really low to decent gives a bigger benefit than taking a decent defence to great.
100 ATK vs. 50, 75, 100, 125, 150 Defence gives damage multipliers of 2.0, 1.33, 1.0, 0.8, 0.67. You can see how there's diminishing returns and the biggest difference in damage dealt is from 50 to 75 Defence. That difference in an in-game setting is far more useful than 100 to 125. That being said a defensive pivot is great to have since 75 and 200 Defence still have a gap of 0.83.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52858691
Yeah. You can always just do some calculations and see how much you can EV before reaching a level cap or level you want to end at.
Just think of the earliest area you can find those EVs, in RSEORAS you can get Attack EVs from Level 2-3 Poochyena at route 1.
>TotalEVs=EXPlimit/AverageEXPperKill
Then you add them in PkHex, or use Vitamins to the nearest 10 up to 100, you hack into the PC storage or bag.
I personally have no qualms about that, it's functionally the same as grinding since there's no danger of getting killed anyway.
I don't add money, TMs, tokens etc. since those are a finite resources, or uncertain in the case of non-savescummed tokens, but stuff like multiplying berries once I've found them or the EV training trick are fair game since it's just cutting out tedium that I could do on hardware.

tl;dr: Anything that is available, safe, and possible to do in-game is fine to hack in.

Ryme's fight being a double battle was fun.
>Vs Ryme
>Banette and Mimikyu
I send out Greensleeves(Covert Cloak) and Douce Dame(Chesto Berry).
>Turn 1
Douce Dame breaks Mimikyu's Disguise with Ice Shard, and Greensleeves Terastalizes and Flower Tricks it into oblivion. Banette hits both my mons with Icy Wind, dropping Douce Dame's speed.
The Audience cheers for my squad, raising all their stats(because I got the first KO with a Terastal, I think).
>Houndstone sent in
>Turn 2
Banette fails a Sucker Punch aimed at Douce Dame. Greensleeves oneshots it with Flower Trick. Douce Dame sets up a Snowscape. Houndstone disappears with Phantom Force.
Audience buffs me again thanks to another KO.
>Toxtricity in
>Turn 3
My mons team up on Toxtricity, taking it out with Ice Shard into Flower Trick. Houndstone's Phantom Force hits Douce Dame, who laughs it off.
>Turn 4
Another team combo Ice Shard and Flower Trick finishes the battle.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Black 2 randomized run (including items and abilities), set mode

I'm about to grind for the elite 4 and champion battle

>Salamance (starter)
Good stats, lacks a physical dragon type move (doesn't get dragon claw until lvl 61, no tm for it either) which kinda sucks but stab dragonbreath + fly is pretty strong and drain punch + ice fang gives it pretty good coverage

>Choiceband Darmanitan
stab flareblitz and superpower one shots basically any 2x or 4x weakness and even most 1x weakness mons too.

>Leftovers Forretress
Tanky piece of shit, great for pivots, has shadow sneak and stab gyroball, but isn't really suited for dealing any meaningful amount of damage. Also has volt absorb which is nice ig if one of the e4 randomizes to have an electric team.

>Cofagrigus
Another tanky fuck for switching into normal/fighting moves, also generally high def. Has willowwisp for slowing down physical attackers and decent stab shadow ball, with an alright sp.atk.

>Sniper Togekiss
Serene grace would have been nutty, but alas, I'll take the improved crits though. Good sp.def. too for switching into, and great sp.atk. Doesn't really contribute with any coverage however.

>Empoleon
Aqua Jet for priority, and stab surf is pretty alright, good defensive option for pivoting back into Darmanitan or Salamence I suppose, not completely sold on it

Any input on the final team? It's been a rough run so far

But it's still a stretch to assume that the Professor was just the Legendary acting through the professor as if possessed. Even if they may have influenced them or even possessed them momentarily.

I just don't get why one would assume that the Paradise Protection Protocol is anything but what it says it is.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I think AI Professor isn't fully aware of the PPP because s/he (I played Scarlet) was created kind of early compared to when the real professor died, so AI Professor's mind isn't actually 100% accurate to the real one that must have had changes of opinions and beliefs through their work.
I think it is implied that the AI was created shortly after Turo/Sada's partner left, which was many years ago since Arven was still very young.

The Professor's initial dream was to uncover the secrets of Area Zero and s/he was aware of how dangerous releasing Paradoxes would be for Paldea's ecosystem, but I think s/he underestimated their real danger until s/he brought the more ferocious Korai/Miraidon to the present.
Our Korai/Mirai is very tame, to the point that it is implied the Professor felt safe letting it around little Arven.

AI Professor's wish to visit the Past/Future and stay there also implies there's a lot s/he isn't aware of when it comes to the Real Professor's mind and how the experiments with the time machine changed her/him.

AI is a timestamp of the real Professor at the time of her/his creation, which was far before Sada/Turo actually managed to build the Time Machine.
PPP seems to be the projection of Sada/Turo's newer plan, which s/he formed possibly after the time machine was already functioning and that for some reason s/he kept secret from their AI self.

This definitely shows signs of madness/external manipulation, because the real Professor (or whoever manipulated them, 3rd Legendary or someone else) knew that their own self from several years ago and their common sense would be a threat to the accomplishment of the Paradise project.

I think the second AI is another timestamp of the real Professor's mind but at the time of the creation of PPP, which is arguably several years after the creation of the first AI and thus has added knowledge and different feelings and ideas.

>>52874229
Mimic has 10 PP, whether it's as Mimic or a copied move. For example if the Mewtwo uses Horn Drill once, switches out, switches back in, then it will show Mimic with 8 PP. And then if it mimics Horn Drill again it will say 7/5. If you mimic Horn Drill when you have 6 PP, the next turn it will show 5/5.

I don't think it's a glitch, I'm pretty sure that's how they intended it to work. It's not like Psychic being immune to Ghost which was an obvious mistake.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>White 2 releases
>Catch a Mold Breaker Drilbur in the Dream World
>Name him Digger Dan
>Drilbur is absolute dog shit until its level is in the 20s and it starts learning some passable moves (and I later found out that Digger Dan had 0 HP IVs)
> Fall in to a routine of sending him out, seeing "Digger Dan breaks the mold!" and then watching him get one-shot killed by everything under the sun
>Eventually became really endearing in an underdog sort of way, I kept sending Digger Dan out because I wanted to see if he could actually fucking do something useful for once
>Becomes Excadrill and instantly shoots past the rest of my team and becomes my ace
>Transferred him everywhere I could since then, and use him as my ace in my post-game teams

The ballad of Digger Dan endeared me to Drilbur so much that just looking at this dopey little asshole warms my heart a bit. There are Pokemon whose design I like better, or are more interesting to use in-game, but none of them have sentimental value like Drilbur does.

posts.com:
I always liked him from the moment he was revealed, but he didn't become my #1 until I used him in Colosseum and he steamrolled everything in his path, all the while being the most nonchalant happy dope in the face of danger. Anything that is basically a giant blob with a :) face is peak character design to me. In fact, I love this line so much that my new top three of all time are Quagsire, Wooper, and Clodsire.

My ace? Clodsire is definitely one of my most reliable Pokemon on my Scarlet team, and Quagsire is usually pretty solid whenever I use him, but I'm not sure if they're ace material. These guys seem more than content not to hog the spotlight, which is part of what I like about them. My Pikachu? Maybe Wooper, but there are several other little guys that I'd rather have perched on my shoulder, like Swirlix, Rookidee, Zigzagoon, or Shinx. They just seem more cuddly and pleasant to the touch than a slimy axolotl.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Very short explanations
Unown: I had a VHS of the Mystery of Unown movie long ago, and could always relate a bit to the main character. I didn't really feel alone, but usually I felt powerless. I guess I always wished I could be doted on and pampered, in a way. In my mind, who wouldn't? So when I saw the Unowns able to change reality just to please some little girl, I liked them. They seemed so alien and otherwordly, and I was intrigued with the actual mystery of the Pokémon Unown. We knew all we needed to know and more about legendaries back then in the era pre-internet but these little guys were a complete intrigue. As I grew older, I appreciated them more from a design standpoint,and as I got much much older I kinda developed a fetish for them. My favorite Unowns are !, i, x, t and q. In-games, I would much rather have ! or i.
Luvdisc: My first boyfriend ever gifted me one on Pokémon Black, and I used it religiously. It was probably just a cliche gesture, but I grow attached to them and all they represent, and I used Luvdisc during my Pokémon Black first playthrough, which I did on a somewhat "dark" point of my life when I underwent lots of emotional turmoil. It has been several years since that, and the relationship with that guy are all but history, but my love for Luvdisc remains. I always found ironic how the Pokémon meant to represent a lovely gift is so loated by the fans, but I always treasure the fish.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52867517
I absolutely love this big fat ball of happiness like you wouldn't believe. If it's available in a game, I will almost certainly include one in my final team.
>Why?
A simple and attractive design, and is just brimming with joy. I can't help but smile when I see it. Also, in a game where Pokemon usually cap at 400 or so HP at most, having a behemoth with nearly 800 HP made me feel like a boss trainer.
>Are they the ace on your team?
Can't really call it an ace. But it absolutely was back in the early days of Pokemon GO. With how the gym system worked, I invested as much as I could into as many Chanseys as possible, knowing that my girl Blissey would dominate hard once Gen 2 hit the game. I even used my favorite one for offensive battles and raids after the gym rework.
I don't play Unite, but if I did, Blissey would most definitely be my go-to.
>Your pikachu?
Nowadays, yes. I don't play competitive and never will, but I always make an effort to make her work, even if it's just for a casual in-game run.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52879555
That was the whole idea behind Hidden Abilities in Gen 5. They were "Dream World" abilities. As in, abilities the Pokemon wishes it could have/do, and almost always play into the Pokemon's personality/lifestyle.
In this case, Durant wanted Truant. Ants are known to be workaholics, so Durant dreams about getting to be lazy.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52877771
Pretty much every old ability needs to be reworked.
It's clear that in gen 3, GF was thinking of abilities in a different way.
I think at the time, they were thinking of abilities as mainly a gimmick and not something that would define a mon. Which is why the abilities were so simple and there's a wide gap between how good they are.
I don't think they even put enough thought into the abilities to realize that shit like Intimidate and Swift Swim would be meta defining, while shit like Inner Focus and Water Veil are situational at best.

They've gotten a lot better since then, but now there's just a really obvious difference between old and new abilities.

I haven't read much other Pokemanga but since I've been getting back into Pokemon lately I kinda wanna start now. I love Electric Tale but that's about all I've actually read. Mixed feelings on what I know about Special.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52871201
Magical Pokemon Journey was a really early Viz manga back when they were publishing manga in comic book format. They were released on really cheap paper and would fall apart easily, so it's no surprise that they are hard to come by. I don't know if they ever got paperback releases, but it sold so poorly in the west that Viz never finished publishing it. The last two or three volumes never got released by Viz.

As for me, I found a full set of Pokemon Diamond and Pearl Adventure at a used book store a few weeks ago that I picked up. I haven't had time to read them yet because of how hectic the holiday season is, but I plan on reading it soon. I had the first two volumes as a kid, but I don't remember anything about it.

All of the manga are obscure, even Pokemon Special

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52878352
the manga aren't directly controlled/commissioned by the pokemon company like the ashnime is, as long as you follow their standards anyone can try to write one if they want (maybe not anyone but you know what i mean)

i don't know much about diamond and pearl adventure, but i'm assuming the guy just wanted to come in and write a story adapting gen 4 and got greenlit
the difference is that he stuck with his story through to the end, a lot of them just sputter out and die after a few chapters because of low reader interest
there were other gen 4 manga that died off quickly in the same timeframe, and there have always been other manga running at the same time as special throughout its life

on the topic of having the same publishers, shogakukan publishes everything so it's not that weird
it doesn't matter to them if there are two similar products on the market at the same time, and it's not like tpc is enforcing exclusivity for special

posts.com:
Theme without refining execution is Digimon.
Theme while incorporating animalistic traits is modern Pokemon design.
The stealth bomber of Dragapult isn't the only reason it's ghost type, it's based on an extinct species of salamanders and pretty heavily takes cues for its body design.
Decidueye was based on an extinct Hawaiian owl called the Stilt Owl on top of being an archer with Robinhood themes.
There's of course some exceptions to the rule at times but generally most all Pokemon these days carry at least a combination of one object/job/thing and a real animal or plant inspiration.

>>52822483
The first fanfic I ever read when I was 12 was an Altoshipping fic called "Guardian of the Chosen One" by XD-385. It gets a bit insane with a dark shonen plot where Ash basically discovers he has Goku-esque superpowers (because he's the "Chosen One" mentioned in the Orange Islands), but it's a guilty pleasure that I still enjoy. There's only a couple nsfw chapters sprinkled throughout a much larger story; it takes place during Ash's Hoenn journey, and Ash finds himself missing Latias so much that he decides to go back and visit her in Alto Mare. He and Latias reconnect, have sex, have two shiny Lati babies, and eventually get married. And I LOVED all of it. I should really re-read it again sometime.
https://www.fanfiction.net/s/11010948/1/Guardian-of-the-Chosen-One

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>52874405
IIRC, the differences in Pokemon data structure result in NEEDING a "buffer" to present the GB/C data to the GBA games as legible Pokemon, and there's some firmware awkwardness in cross-applying the Link Cable protocols.

The two realistic options are a GBA-N64 connector or the GBA-GameCube connector being compatible with the GB/C link cable protocol, to wash it through Stadium or Colosseum. Less realistically, e-reader or gameshark data injection shenanigans may be able to jailbreak the GBA in the required fashions.

>>52877213
By physically cutting apart the two different Link Cables to wire them to a modern microcomputer converting the signals in both protocol and data terms. So literally building a specialized third-party peripheral. It was always the interface hardware, that's what Game Freak told the magazines back in the day and what everyone who's dug into the problem finds.

>>52870392
>I stonefaced through the entirety of Saving Private Ryan
I'm glad to learn that I'm not the only one who wasn't really touched by it. The opening action and a few scenes were well crafted, but it's hard to say, "Thank God the Matt Damon bloodline will have a chance to perpetuate!" (Were it made today, the twist ending would be that he's the gay brother. In your face, patrilineal boomer culture!)

>The Green Mile
I think it somewhat depends on whether your mindset is of empathy or sympathy. With the Noble Sacrifice trope in play, my mindset is to respect the choice but not feel bad about it, rather to honor it. Others would feel bad with the sacrificial action and feel bad that the greater good is done at a great cost.

>Requiem for a Dream
Again, I can respect the choice but I don't feel bad about it. Do drugs, fine; pay the price, fine. To me it's a cautionary tale, not a work of pathos.

>Titanic
Insurance fraud is a heck of a deal. Conspiracy theory aside, it's a nice portrait of people reacting to the near-inevitable. But only the supporting cast interesting. The lead characters are dorks and their scenes mostly feel like a bad soap opera with good production values. Fortunately I got to play with the "chilling at the front of a boat" meme in my long-neglected next story.

>the finale of Cowboy Bebop
I like how despite the cliche anime "action" there's a load of tiny callbacks that respect viewers for paying attention to the motifs carried by the plot.

>a greater sense of despair and despondency than just about any other work has?
I don't outline, so things can go realistically badly without concern for a Hollywood Ending moment.

posts.name: cge0361
posts.com:
>>52874191
>/vpwt/ is an unresurectable community
I've seen the thread reappear occasionally, but it no longer endures. Talking out of my ass, I'd lay the blame on:

1) the "old guard" leaving, mostly to OC so they would have market potential, which is understandable.
2) too few newbies/too many celebs. There were a couple of writers updating frequently but very few ambitious beginners looking to get meaningful critique on ideas for short pieces. We used to have a lot of that. Without, the thread turns into a RSS feed.
3) Lack of fresh commentary. As the thread became increasingly two people updating and someone save bumping, the thread became boring to read.
4) PMD began dominating. Although the species are the same, there's a huge difference in the context frame between humans+pokemon versus pokemon living in a mock-human society. That isn't to say that PMD is worse or better, but that it's easy for people who want stories about humans interacting with pokemon to feel underserved when PMD becomes all that's updating.
5) Discord extracted what little social conversation was left.

>I never did read anything of yours while it existed, though.
Understandable and expected, it was a while ago.

>I'd add my own Mienshao fics to the pile but all I have is fetish smut
Although I've always been extra critical of lemons, I appreciate when an author "validates" a fetish by making a story that features, but is not defined by, topics that are typically cheap fetish tones. I've touched on at least a half dozen fetish categories, but by touching and exploring instead of just re-walking the lemons' default paths, it can not only tell a story most wouldn't notice could be told, but also fly under the radar.

>the fourth book in a series that's 400k words long
Sounds like you've put in the reps

>What do you think you'd write if you started again?
Hopefully the other half of my next story that's been waiting for me to work it out.

Since pokemon invoked the existence of a multiverse a couple generations back, you can say that G/S/C takes place in a different universe/timeline from HG/SS. Or you could just decide that G/S/C is 100% noncanon and is fully replaced by the similar-but-slightly-different HG/SS content. Either way the idea of steel types being " recently discovered" doesn't work if you allow for the type chart to be something that exists within canon rather than a game extraction, because then the nature of reality somehow changes as pokemon researchers discover things. The setting turns into madness where subjective reality trumps scientific rigor and it gets worse then harder you try to make it make sense. Best to just ignore the retcon.

Of course it's not guaranteed, it's probability. The issue with R/S/E specifically is that the rng is frozen, unless in R/S's case where the battery is working. FRLG do not have this problem however, which you should take advantage of wherever you can, like I did for Deoxys in pic rel.

>>52863163
Depends on how long it takes to encounter, run from, walk to the door and back to Rayquaza. Maybe around 30 seconds? Keep in mind, in R/S, Rayquaza does not reappear if you run away, so you have to do it in Emerald (Or have a working battery in R/S for soft reset), and therefore you have to do run away encounters.
